abstract: Sets the class that creates the shared font manager object.
overview:
## Discussion

When you call the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSFontManager/shared] method of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSFontManager], it creates an instance of `aClass`, if no instance already exists. The class in `aClass` must implement `init` as its designated initializer. The default font manager factory is `NSFontManager`.

Call this method before AppKit loads your application’s main nib file, such as in your app delegate’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplicationDelegate/applicationWillFinishLaunching(_:)] method.

# setFontManagerFactory(_:)

**Type Method**

Sets the class that creates the shared font manager object.

## Declaration

```swift
class func setFontManagerFactory(_ factoryId: AnyClass?)
```

## Parameters

- **factoryId**: The new font manager factory class, which must be a subclass of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSFontManager].

## Discussion

When you call the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSFontManager/shared] method of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSFontManager], it creates an instance of `aClass`, if no instance already exists. The class in `aClass` must implement `init` as its designated initializer. The default font manager factory is `NSFontManager`.

Call this method before AppKit loads your application’s main nib file, such as in your app delegate’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplicationDelegate/applicationWillFinishLaunching(_:)] method.

## Changing the Default Font Conversion Classes

- **setFontPanelFactory(_:)**: Sets the class that creates the shared Font panel object.
